alert.note: Alert for Wexford (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 12:25PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Manistee River near Sherman affecting Wexford County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Manistee River...including Sherman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Manistee River near Sherman. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding begins around the Wilderness Canoe livery along left bank of river just downstream of M-37 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 03/29/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight as additional forecast information becomes available.
